title: Peter the First (1986) Petr Perviy
description:
Film One - The Youth of Peter the Great (1981). 
The first part of the two films about the Russian Emperor Peter the Great, based upon the novel ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œPeter the FirstÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ by Alexei Tolstoy. Combined in this two-series epic are the colorful personality of Peter, the ever interesting ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œfatal minutesÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ of world history, the literary talent of ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œRed CountÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ Alexei Tolstoy and the mastery of one of the best Soviet film directors ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ Sergey Gerasimov.
The years of the tsarÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s adolescence and youth were permeated with deadly danger coming from some of the Boyars, the rebellious Streltsy and Tsarevna Sophia who aspired for power. But already at that early time Peter demonstrates a profound, bright intellect, a strong will and the sense of purpose, which help him disarm both his open and secret enemies.

The second film - At the Beginning of Glorious Days (1987)
At the end of the 17th century, without an access to sea, Russia is in a vulnerable position in foreign trade. Peter the Great attempts to conquer the Turkish sea fortress of Azov but realises that could only be done with a modern fleet. To the amazement of Europe, he goes to Holland and works at a dock learning the know-how of shipbuildingÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦
This is the second of the two films dedicated to Peter the Great, based on the eponymous novel of Alexei Tolstoy. Actor Dmitri Zolotukhin (Peter the Great) was named the most popular actor of 1981 after the poll conductd by Soviet Screen magazine. ...
